While in its shell, the tortle is {@condition prone}, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

action.name: Wild Shape (2/rest)
entries: As a bonus action the druid can turn into a beast with a CR of 4 or lower, or into a CR 5 or lower elemental.

entries.name: Tortles
entries: Tortles are omnivorous, turtle-like humanoids with shells that cover most of their bodies. Tortles have a saying: "We wear our homes on our backs." Consequently, tortles feel little need to stay put for long.
An adult tortle stands about 6 feet tall and weighs between 450 and 500 pounds. Males and females are nearly identical in size and appearance.

entries.name: Temporary Towns
entries: A tortle settlement is primarily used as a kind of moot, where tortles can socialize with one another and trade with strangers. Tortles don't regard these settlements as places worth defending with their lives, and they abandon a settlement when it no longer serves their needs.

entries.name: A Life of Wandering
entries: Most tortles like to see how other creatures live and discover new customs. The urge to procreate doesn't kick in until the end of a tortle's life, and a tortle can spend decades away from its native land without feeling homesick.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The wyvern deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wyvern makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its stinger. While flying, it can use its claws in place of one other attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the wyvern can't use its claw on another target.

action.name: Stinger (3/day)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@i This wyvern's thick armor, jagged claws, and heavy brow belies a pair of intelligent eyes. It looks upon its rider like a hound looks at its master.}

Bred to be fearsome, obedient, and intelligent mounts for elite knights, war wyverns are superior in all ways to their wild cousins. Their natural scales are enhanced with thick steel scale armor, and selective breeding has granted them the ability to spit venom, in addition to delivering it with their scorpion-like tails.

entries.name: Loyal and Deadly
entries: A war wyvern is unflinchingly loyal and has been taught to unerringly follow verbal commands given by its master. In military situations, a wyvern's master will often command it to snatch cavalry riders from their horses with its steel-tipped talons, hurling them to their doom, or to use its spiked tail to smash siege weapons or supply wagons. Despite their viciousness on the battlefield, these domesticated wyverns serve their masters out of love, not fear, and act like energetic pit bulls when around those who treat them with kindness.

entries.name: Two Fight as One
entries: Wyvern knights and their war wyverns act as a single unit in combat. A war wyvern cannot move or take actions independently while it is being used as a mount, but its specialized training gives it the ability to make a single attack when its rider takes the Multiattack action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Xandala is a 17th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks).
She has 17 sorcery points that she can use for her meta-magics.
Xandala can add +10 to the damage to spells indicated by a *.
Xandala has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

spells: {@spell whirlwind|XGE} can combine with fire spell*

trait.name: Quickened Spell
entries: When she casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, Xandala changes the casting time to 1 bonus action for that casting using 2 sorcery points.

trait.name: Magic items
entries: {@item Red Dragon Mask|RoTOS}; {@item bracers of defense} witch has 6 charges that it can use to cast the following spells by expending charges equal to the spell level: {@spell Absorb Elements|XGE}, {@spell Shield} and {@spell Otiluke's Resilient Sphere}; a spell focus that gives +2 to spell attack and saving throws.

trait.name: Briliant Flames
entries: Xandala can add twice her charisma modifier to the damage of any spell that deals fire or radinat damage.

trait.name: Twinned Spell
entries: When Xandala casts a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, she can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

trait.name: Subtle Spell
entries: When Xandala casts a spell, she can spend 1 sorcery point to cast it without any somatic or verbal components.

trait.name: Twist spell
entries: When Xandala casts a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, she can spend 1 sorcery point to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder. Additionaly she can change fire damage to radiant.

trait.name: Dragonfire
entries: If Xandala deals fire damage to a creature or flammable object, it starts burning. At the start of each of its turns, a creature burning in this way takes 1d6 fire damage. A creature that can reach the burning target can use an action to extinguish the fire.

action.name: Firebolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 120 ft., one or two target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) fire damage and the target is set ablaze, suffering an additional 8 ({@damage 1d6 + 10}) fire damage at the start of its turn. A creature that can reach the burning target can use an action to extinguish the fire.

The half-elf sorcerer Xandala has come to Chult in search of the Ring of Winter, an artifact in Artus Cimber's possession. Xandala knows that the ring has kept Artus alive for over a century, and she craves its power. If she meets the characters, Xandala pretends to be Artus's daughter and tries to convince them to help her find him. Her plan is to cast dominate person on Artus and force him to give her the ring, then escape using her {@spell fly} spell.

Xandala's magic traces back to a draconic bloodline, and parts of her skin are covered by a thin sheen of protective scales. She has befriended a pseudodragon named Summerwise, who thinks that Xandala's quest for the ring is dangerous but has given up trying to talk the sorcerer out of it. Summerwise can be turned against Xandala by good-aligned characters.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "I have the blood of dragons flowing through my veins. I am destined for greatness."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "The Ring of Winter will bring me power and immortality."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm surrounded by fools."

trait.name: Harvest of Life (1/Turn)
entries: When necromancer deals necrotic damage to a creature that is neither a construct nor undead with a spell of 1st level or higher, the necromancer regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic items
entries: Magic blood - gives 15 sorc points and can use Twin Spell
Brooch of Shielding

trait.name: Recently Died
entries: The necromancer suffers a -3 penalty all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks.

mythicHeader: The necromancer has a Contingency spell active.

mythic.name: Contingency: Antilife Shell
entries: If any living creature attempts so step closer than 10 ft. to the necromancer the spell Antilife Shell activates blocking the creacure

Necromancers are specialist wizards who study the interaction of life, death, and undeath. Some like to dig up corpses to create undead slaves. A few use their powers for good, becoming hunters of the undead and risking their lives to save others.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The magi is a 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Alter Energy Type (1/Turn)
entries: When the magi casts a spell with a spell slot and the spell deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, it can substitute that damage with one other type from that list.

trait.name: Gillded staff
entries: {@item Staff of the Ivory Claw|egw} but also works for her claw and bite attacks in hybrid and tiger forms.

trait.name: Robe of the Magi
entries: {@item Robe of the Archmagi} but the item is very rare without the +2 to spellcasting ability boon.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The magi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pounce (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: If the weretiger moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the weretiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The weretiger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The weretiger can use its action to polymorph into a tiger-humanoid hybrid or into a tiger, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed except magic items attuned to the weretiger. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: In hybrid form, the weretiger can make two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with weretiger lycanthropy.
